page.title: 08THE EGG FARM
page.content: THE EGG FARM There are about 333000 chickens on the egg farm.A very good layer will lay about 520 eggs per year, but a normal layer will lay round about 400 eggs per year.A good layer should lay 10 eggs a week.There are about 14 sheds altogether at the egg farm owned by Keith & Kath Coulling.If the owner is away William Winship is in_charge of the entire egg farm.When there is a power cut, or something breaks down, such as an incubator and the people can't fix it quickly 100's of chickens die.But only if its off for a long time. A few years ago there was a disease called FOWL PEST which killed hundreds of tiny chickens. Recently two new hen houses have been built on the farm which was first used almost one hundred years ago.
